meanings.definition: Declared or announced verbally rather than in writing.
meanings.sent1: The nuncupative agreement was made through spoken words.
meanings.sent2: She preferred nuncupative communication over written messages.
meanings.sent3: The nuncupative announcement caused a lot of excitement in the room.
meanings.sent4: His nuncupative promise echoed in her mind long after he had left.
meanings.sent5: The nuncupative declaration was so clear that no one could misunderstand.

meanings.sent1: Their nuncupative conversation was filled with laughter.
meanings.sent2: The nuncupative tradition was passed down through generations.
meanings.sent3: The nuncupative story made everyone burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: Her nuncupative warning rang in his ears like a bell.
meanings.sent5: The nuncupative message was so powerful that it stayed with him forever.
